--- title: "Extreme Value Analysis 2027" toc: true --- Welcome on the home page of *Extreme Value Analysis* 2027 (EVA 2027). EVA is a biennial international conference on extreme value analysis, probabilistic and statistical models and their applications. The 15th edition will be hosted by [HEC Montréal](www.hec.ca) in downtown Montréal (Québec, Canada) at the [Hélène-Desmarais building](https://www.hec.ca/en/campus/helene-desmarais/index.html) from Monday July 5th until Friday July 9th, 2027. Satellite workshops and courses will take place on Sunday, July 4th, as well as the week before the conference starts. ## History The inception of EVA dates back to Vimeiro meeting in Portugal in 1983 in August 31st--September 14th. Further meetings in the field were organized in Oberwolfach with the 1987 Conference on *Extremewertheorie*, and the Gaithersburg 1993 Conference on Extreme Value Theory and its Applications. Previous editions of EVA took place in: - Göteborg, Sweden (1998) - Leuven, Belgium (2001) - Aveiro, Portugal (2004) - [Göteborg, Sweden (2005)](http://www.math.ku.dk/~mikosch/maphysto_extremes_2005/extremes.html) - Bern, Switzerland (2007) - [Fort Collins, Colorado, USA (2009)](http://www.stat.colostate.edu/graybillconference2009/) - [Lyon, France (2011)](http://eva2011.univ-lyon1.fr/) - Shanghai, China (2013) - [Ann Arbor, Michigan, USA (2015)](https://sites.lsa.umich.edu/eva2015/) - Delft, Netherlands (2017) - [Zagreb, Croatia (2019)](https://web.math.pmf.unizg.hr/eva2019/) - [Edinburgh, UK (2021, virtual)](https://www.maths.ed.ac.uk/school-of-mathematics/events/past-events/eva-2021) - [Milano, Italy (2023)](https://dec.unibocconi.eu/research/extreme-value-analysis-eva-2023) - [Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA (2025)](https://eva2025.unc.edu/) ## Location ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: The address of the venue is 501, rue de la Gauchetière Ouest, Montréal, H2Z 1Z5. The downtown campus is easily reached by public transport, either via [metro](https://www.stm.info/en/info/networks/metro) ([Square-Victoria-OACI station](https://www.stm.info/fr/infos/reseaux/metro/square-victoria-oaci), orange line), or from the [Gare Centrale REM station](https://rem.info/en/travelling/stations/gare-centrale). The coffee breaks and standing lunches will take place in the A.373 Centre de conférence Claude-Séguin, located next to the *Entrée Famille Karim (boul. René-Lévesque Ouest).* Plenary talks will take place in room A.335 Amphithéâtre Rachelle et Alain-Paris. Registration will be at room A.393. Contributed and invited talks will be in classrooms - C.403 Louis-R.-Chênevert - C.409 Gilles-Labbé - C.415 Pierre Fitzgibbon - C.406 Josée-Fiset - C.412 Malette ## Practical information [Montreal Tourism office](https://www.mtl.org/en/what-to-do/business-events) has practical information about the city. You may need an [electronic travel authorization (eTA)](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/visit-canada/eta.html) or a visitor visa. Check this [video](https://youtu.be/aYz9de2Qd_U?list=TLGGbdshJm7bkEQwODA3MjAyNQ) for more details about the application. Please contact the organizing committee if you need a letter for your visa application. [Montréal-Trudeau International Airport (YUL)](https://www.admtl.com/en-CA/) is well connected with major American and European cities. The airport is easily reached via the [747 bus](https://www.stm.info/en/info/networks/bus-network-and-schedules-enlightened/747-yul-montreal-trudeau-airport-downtown). The organizing committee will contact hotels to book rooms at a discounted rate. There are [numerous hostels, hotels and bed and breakfasts close to downtown](https://www.mtl.org/en/Accommodations?prod_en_random%5BrefinementList%5D%5B_filter_product_neighbourhoods%5D%5B0%5D=Downtown&prod_en_random%5BrefinementList%5D%5B_filter_product_neighbourhoods%5D%5B1%5D=Les%20Quartiers%20du%20Canal&prod_en_random%5BrefinementList%5D%5B_filter_product_neighbourhoods%5D%5B2%5D=Mount%20Royal%2C%20Outremont%20and%20Westmount&prod_en_random%5BrefinementList%5D%5B_filter_product_neighbourhoods%5D%5B3%5D=Old%20Montr%C3%A9al%20and%20Old%20Port). ## Scientific committee The scientific committee of the event will allocate invited sessions and plenary talks.
